title: Deco ID Needed
content:
Can anyone name the “Quasi” type used in this Aesthetic Apparatus poster.

I’ve found similar that can be tweaked to look carved. But, wondering if there’s an original or equal to it.

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Quasi_5189.png)

 [‹ Help Id Decorative Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39460 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Notes Soft"? non aligning numerals ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39452 "Go to next forum topic")
author: designernewyork

comments.content: First thing I thought of was H&FJ’s [Shades](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100023) series, but it’s none of those. Nor is it [PowerStation](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000296).

You can find a tutorial on [how to draw prismatic type](http://web.archive.org/web/20071128112259/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/tipsandtricks/prismaticeffects/index.shtml) over at Letterhead Fonts. Doesn’t AA use some hand-drawn stuff too?
